misconceptions.inferred_category_name: No misconception detected (correct loop-based pattern generation)
misconceptions.student_thought_process: The student believes nested loops can control rows and columns of output: the outer loop counts rows (1..N) and the inner loop prints the correct number of '*' for that row, then a newline.
misconceptions.conceptual_gap: No conceptual gap is evident here. The code matches Java’s execution model: variables change only via assignment (i++, j++), printing happens exactly when the print statements execute, and the prompt is just a string literal shown to the user.
misconceptions.error_manifestation: No error; produces the required output for positive N.
